Sentencas: To increase the long term stability and performance of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) materials, it is important to understand the main degradation processes in their functional layers.
Titulo: In Situ X-Ray Diffraction and Stress Analysis of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this work, the interface between electrolyte and anode material was investigated by in situ X-ray diffraction (XRD) stress and phase analysis.
Titulo: In Situ X-Ray Diffraction and Stress Analysis of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It has been found that the determining process for the initial degradation of SOFC is the reduction of the anode material with hydrogen.
Titulo: In Situ X-Ray Diffraction and Stress Analysis of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: During this process a tensile strength of 600-700MPa is measured.
Titulo: In Situ X-Ray Diffraction and Stress Analysis of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: These stresses are induced in the electrolyte material and produce crack networks.
Titulo: In Situ X-Ray Diffraction and Stress Analysis of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The reduction from nickel oxide to pure nickel was monitored by in situ phase analysis.
Titulo: In Situ X-Ray Diffraction and Stress Analysis of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This reaction induces tensile stress at the interface between electrolyte and anode.
Titulo: In Situ X-Ray Diffraction and Stress Analysis of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The stress produced in the electrolyte material was also confirmed by the observation of crack networks detected using scanning electron microscopy (SEM).
Titulo: In Situ X-Ray Diffraction and Stress Analysis of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Finally, the reducing process was optimized using different process gases, decreasing the destructive tensile stress level.
Titulo: In Situ X-Ray Diffraction and Stress Analysis of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
